alert.note: Alert for City of Norfolk; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 6:31PM EDT until June 25 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE EASTERN CITY OF NORFOLK AND THE NORTHWESTERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms have produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Ocean View, Norfolk, Norfolk International, Norfolk NAS, Bayside, Princess Anne Plaza, London Bridge, Wards Corner, Oceana NAS and Willoughby Spit. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Norfolk; City of Virginia Beach
